title: Is it okay for teenagers to watch Spartacus (TV series)? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would say not. And I say that as a huge fan of the show. The violence, especially in the early episodes, is reduced to comic-book, 300 movie level—ie, made to look video-game cool. I actually didn’t care for the first few shows. The sex depicted is not loving sex, but all about dominance—nearly softcore porn. I don’t think the depiction is necessarily wrong, given the storyline in which everybody is trying to get over on everyone else, but I wouldn’t want my kids growing up thinking that’s how a normal loving relationship is conducted. The way people conduct themselves in Spartacus may be historically correct (thought I’m not really positive about that—it’s not exactly a documentary about Roman morals), but it’s certainly not how adult people should conduct themselves now. Unless you’re willing to sit there watch with them and explain that to your kids, then no.
